snippet: The agencies have created cells to look at potential problems in the wake of President Bashar al-Assad’s fall, hoping to avert the types of mistakes made after the invasion of Iraq.
abstract: United States is quietly sharpening plans to cope with a flood of refugees, help maintain basic health and municipal services, restart a shattered economy and avoid a security vacuum in the wake of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's fall.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: The agencies have created cells to look at potential problems in the wake of President Bashar al-Assad’s fall, hoping to avert the types of mistakes made after the invasion of Iraq.
